tourName: 7 days in Chicago holiday, USA
generalInfo: Discover Chicago, one of the largest cities in the USA and famed for its bold architecture. On this 7-day trip, you will have plenty of time to explore the city, its highlights, nightlife and hidden gems. You will also be able to explore one of the many beaches or relax and swim in the Lake Michigan water.

dayInfo.description: Step into the vibrant pulse of Chicago! As you touch down in this dynamic city, feel the excitement bubbling around you. From the iconic skyline along Lake Michigan to the savory aromas wafting from renowned eateries, every corner of Chicago beckons with adventure. After your smooth arrival, dive into the city's energy. Whether you opt to stroll along the riverwalk, marvel at the architectural wonders, or savor a taste of deep-dish pizza, Chicago's charm will captivate you. As night falls, indulge in a delightful dinner at one of the city's culinary hotspots, fueling your anticipation for the days ahead. Rest up in your comfortable accommodation, ready to embark on your Chicago journey refreshed and brimming with anticipation!

Embark on a thrilling journey through Chicago's eclectic wonders! Begin your day at Millennium Park, where modern art meets urban oasis. Marvel at Cloud Gate, affectionately known as 'The Bean,' and explore the lush landscapes of Crown Fountain and Lurie Garden. Next, immerse yourself in the artistic tapestry of the Art Institute of Chicago, a treasure trove of masterpieces spanning centuries. Delve into the works of renowned artists like Van Gogh, Monet, Picasso, and Warhol, housed within the majestic Beaux-Arts building. For a taste of Chicago's storied past, step into the legendary Green Mill, where echoes of the roaring twenties linger. Follow in the footsteps of Al Capone as you soak in the ambiance of jazz and poetry, transported back to the era of speakeasies and clandestine charm. Venture further into the city's nightlife scene, uncovering hidden gems like The Violet Hour, where cocktails are crafted with precision and served amidst an aura of mystery. Lose yourself in the soulful melodies of Blue Chicago or Jazz Showcase, or witness enchanting illusions at the captivating Chicago Magic Lounge. With each stop, Chicago unveils its vibrant spirit, promising an unforgettable adventure at every turn!

Prepare for an exhilarating day at Navy Pier, a bustling hub of entertainment and adventure! Meander along the sprawling kilometer-long pier, brimming with an array of shops, parks, and eateries. Immerse yourself in the lush oasis of Crystal Gardens, catch a captivating performance at the Shakespeare Theater, or ignite your imagination at the Chicago Children's Museum. And don't miss the chance to soar above the city on the iconic Ferris wheel, offering breathtaking views of the skyline and Lake Michigan! Afterward, unwind amidst the splendor of Lake Michigan, a sprawling expanse of azure beauty spanning multiple states. Whether you opt for a leisurely boat tour, basking in the panoramic vistas of Chicago's majestic skyline, or choose to lounge on one of the pristine beaches like North Avenue Beach or Oak Street Beach, the tranquil waters beckon. Dive in for a refreshing swim or simply relax on the sandy shores, soaking in the serenity of this natural marvel. Ready to add a boat tour to your itinerary and make waves on Lake Michigan?

Embark on a thrilling adventure with an Architecture River Cruise, setting sail from the vibrant Michigan Avenue and Chicago Riverwalk! Delve into the city's rich history as your expert guide narrates tales of architectural marvels and the legendary Great Chicago Fire. Glide past iconic landmarks like the Wrigley Building, Marina City, and the Tribune Tower, marveling at their intricate designs and storied past. As you navigate the waterways, be mesmerized by the intricate dance of Chicago's moveable bridges, a testament to the city's engineering prowess and innovation. Then, set your sights on Michigan Avenue, known as the 'Magnificent Mile,' where a shopper's paradise awaits. Explore over 450 retailers, from high-end boutiques to renowned department stores, indulging in a retail therapy session like no other. Cap off your day with laughter and entertainment at The Second City, the world-renowned comedy club that has been tickling funny bones since 1959. Prepare for an evening of uproarious laughter as talented comedians deliver top-notch sketch and improv comedy, ensuring an unforgettable experience for all. Ready to add tickets to your itinerary and laugh the night away?

Today we recommend you to do a tour to Oak Park, to visit Frank Lloyd Wright’s Home and Studio. Frank Lloyd Wright was a famous American architect who created some of the most innovative spaces in the United States and designed 1,114 architectural works, 532 of which were completed. On this tour you will visit historic Oak Park, which is a suburb of Chicago and has more Wright buildings than anywhere in the world. You will visit his Home and Studio, which served as home and workplace for Wright’s first 20 years of his career. You can also explore the famous Unity Temple. During the tour you will learn about his visionary Prairie Style and you can see how Wright tried out innovative design ideas in his home. Please let us know if you wish to add this tour to your package.

Today you can visit the amazing Museum of Science and Industry, which is definitely worth a visit. This museum opened in 1993 and is one of the largest museums in the world that concerns science. With a huge range of interactive exhibitions, you can learn more about different topics, from the past to the present. Learn about the U505 submarine, take a look at a "working" coal mine, discover what Chicago looked like at the beginning of the 20th century and go to the simulation lab where you can think about the energy future of Chicago. In the evening you can explore the Chicago Riverwalk for a riverside stroll to see the boats passing by and to enjoy the beautiful buildings. Along the way, there are several restaurants and bars, great for a drink and dinner on the last evening!

Today you will check out of your hotel. If Chicago is your only destination, you can take a taxi or Uber to O'Hare International Airport, from where you will fly back home. If you have other destinations on your itinerary, you will check out of the hotel and pick up your rental car, or take a taxi or Uber to the airport to fly to your next destination.

tourName: Arizona and New Mexico self drive holiday
generalInfo:
Admire the cacti-studded scenery of southern Arizona, exploring Saguaro National Park.
Enjoy scenic drives through forests, deserts and mountains.
Learn all about the Ancestral Puebloan tribes with visits to their ancient cliff dwellings.
Discover the region's Spanish heritage in Santa Fe and visit old mining towns.

dayInfo.description: Today you begin your journey by boarding your international outbound flight to Phoenix. On arrival in Phoenix, collect your hire car and make your way to your accommodation in nearby Scottsdale. The remainder of the day is free to relax after your flight or, depending on your time of arrival, begin exploring the town's shops and restaurants.

Enjoy a full day in Scottsdale. You may wish to go walking in the surrounding mountains, browse downtown Scottsdale, or simply relax around the swimming pool. The Phoenix Art Museum in Scottsdale contains an excellent collection of exhibits from the USA and further afield, or you could head to the nearby Desert Botanical Gardens to admire a variety of trees and plants native to deserts around the world.

Drive south to Tucson, a journey of just over two hours. Along the way you pass Saguaro National Park, which is well worth visiting to see its many large Saguaro cacti. Tucson itself was once a colonial outpost for both the Spanish and Mexicans, as well as having a rich Native American history. On arrival, take in the city's turn-of-the-century architecture and perhaps pay a visit to one of its museums to learn about its varied history. You may also wish to see pre-Columbian and other art at the Tucson Art Museum.

You have a whole day to explore the Tucson area. You could visit the 18th-century San Xavier del Bac Mission, visit the Arizona-Sonora Desert Museum or drive 112 km (70 miles) to We recommend driving to the atmospheric Wild West town of Tombstone, where there's a daily re-enactment of an 1881 gun fight.

Travel east from Tucson and cross into New Mexico. You then travel through the Gila National Forest to the historic mining town of Silver City. The total journey time is around three and a half hours. Once in Silver City, explore the old streets lined with buildings from the late 19th-century mining period.

Spend a full day exploring Silver City, following in the legendary footsteps of Kit Carson and Billy the Kid. From Silver City you can take a scenic drive to explore the fascinating Gila Cliff Dwellings National Monument, set in a dramatic location overlooking the Gila River Canyon. On the way up don't miss a stop at historic Pinos Altos to visit the Buckhorn Saloon and Opera House.

We recommend you take the longer, scenic route on your drive today from Silver City to Albuquerque. This four and a half hour drive takes you over impressive mountain ranges and through the Apache National Forest. Don't miss a visit to the ghost town of Kelly en route. This evening, Albuquerque's many restaurants and live music venues beckon.

After discovering Albuquerque's Route 66 heritage, drive two hours north to Santa Fe. You may wish to explore one of New Mexico's fascinating Ancestral Puebloan villages on the way. Santa Fe itself is one of the USA's oldest cities, founded by Spanish missionaries in the early 17th century. Once you arrive, we suggest exploring the city on foot, taking in the adobe houses and baroque churches and paying a visit to the modern museums and art galleries.

The day is yours to continue exploring Santa Fe. Don't miss the Palace of the Governors, the old Central Plaza, the San Miguel Mission and the Barrio de Analco (historic district) where you can see one of the oldest houses in the country.

Travel two and a half hours north past the Sangre de Cristo Mountains to Taos, which lies close to some of the USA's most impressive Ancestral Puebloan dwelling sites, which you may wish to stop at along the way. You could also stop by the mountain village of Chimayo to see the Spanish colonial church of Santuario de Chimayo, built in 1816.

Enjoy a day to immerse yourself in the native American communities of Taos. Adobe buildings here have been in continual use as residences by native Americans for over 1,000 years and many of today's residents have made few concessions to the modern world, making this a fascinating place to visit.
Drive two hours north into Colorado today. You may wish to stop for a journey on the Cumbres & Toltec Scenic Railway before continuing your journey to Alamosa.
Take the four-hour drive from Alamosa to Denver. At the airport, drop off your hire car before boarding your onward flight.
Arrive back into the UK.

tourName: Arizona self drive holiday, USA
generalInfo: This nine-night adventure offers immersion into Grand Canyon & Saguaro National Parks, Sedona, and more! Optimal during spring and fall, this adventure is possible during summer too. Explore Antelope Canyon, kayak on Lake Powell, soar in a hot air balloon, take on a private jeep and mountain bike tour. With personalized tours in Grand Canyon and Sedona, enjoy guided experiences and leisure. The journey culminates with a private Saguaro National Park tour before departing from Phoenix or Tucson airport. Join us for an unforgettable blend of exploration and relaxation!

dayInfo.description: Today marks the start of your adventure! If arriving by air, please pick up your rental car at Phoenix International Airport in the late morning. If traveling by your own vehicle, head directly to Grand Canyon National Park, where your journey will begin tomorrow.

Embark on an unforgettable adventure as you meet your personal guide for an exclusive tour and invigorating hike along the majestic South Rim of the Grand Canyon. Our expert guides tailor the day's activities to your group's preferences and skill levels, ensuring an experience that perfectly suits you. Delve into the rich tapestry of the canyon's history and geology as you learn about its formation, the diverse flora and fauna that call it home, and the fascinating stories of the indigenous peoples who have inhabited this awe-inspiring landscape for centuries. Cap off your day with a culinary delight at the iconic El Tovar, where you'll savor a delicious dinner against the backdrop of the canyon's breathtaking vistas as the sun sets on this remarkable day of exploration.

Embark on a thrilling journey as you bid farewell to the majestic Grand Canyon and set off for Page, AZ, a scenic 2.5-hour drive away. Upon arrival, prepare to be mesmerized as you embark on a captivating tour of the Lower Antelope Canyon. Guided by knowledgeable experts, navigate the narrow passageways of this iconic slot canyon, marveling at its enchanting beauty and the ethereal play of light and shadow on its walls. Capture the breathtaking sights with your camera as you explore the hidden wonders tucked away within the canyon's depths. Afterwards, unwind and enjoy the evening at your leisure. For those seeking more adventure, consider a self-guided hike to Horseshoe Bend, where the majestic Colorado River meanders gracefully through the stunning desert landscape, creating a natural wonder that will leave you in awe.

Embark on a breathtaking aquatic adventure as you kick off your day with a kayak tour of Lake Powell, surrounded by towering red rock formations that create a stunning backdrop against the crystal-clear waters. Joining a small group, you'll paddle through the serene lake, immersing yourself in the tranquility of nature while gaining an intimate perspective of the shoreline. Discover hidden coves and intricate canyons accessible only by water, unveiling the secrets of this picturesque landscape. Afterwards, bid farewell to the mesmerizing Lake Powell as you embark on a scenic 3-hour drive to Sedona, AZ. Set against a backdrop of dramatic red rock formations and lush greenery, Sedona promises a week filled with enchanting experiences and unforgettable adventures.

Immerse yourself in the timeless beauty of Sedona's crimson-hued landscapes, where the ancient echoes of the Anasazi people whisper tales of old. As you traverse this enchanted terrain, prepare to encounter the legendary Sedona vortex energy, a mystical force said to imbue the region with spiritual power and healing energy. Sedona's extraordinary scenery boasts a mesmerizing array of towering buttes, majestic spires, and sculpted rock formations that stretch endlessly towards the azure skies. Each turn reveals a new marvel, from natural cathedrals to gracefully arched bridges, inviting you to explore and uncover the secrets hidden within. Guided by an expert, your journey will be tailored to your group's desires and abilities, ensuring a hike that not only showcases the wonders of Sedona but also leaves you with a deeper understanding of its rich history and profound significance.

Experience the breathtaking beauty of Sedona as you soar above its majestic landscapes in a hot air balloon at dawn. Marvel at the ethereal sight of the first pink rays of sunlight caressing the crimson-hued rocks, painting the sky with a palette of vibrant morning colors. Later in the afternoon, prepare for an exhilarating off-road adventure through Sedona's rugged backcountry. Accompanied by your private guide and aboard a Pink Jeep, you'll traverse rugged trails and discover hidden vistas that showcase the untamed beauty of this enchanting desert landscape. Prepare to be captivated by panoramic views and thrilling terrain as you embark on a journey through Sedona's wild heart.

Following an exhilarating day of exploration, indulge in a leisurely morning to savor the tranquility of Sedona's captivating surroundings at your own pace. As the early evening approaches, embark on an adrenaline-fueled mountain biking adventure led by your private guide. Feel the thrill as you navigate the rugged terrain and red rock formations, weaving through Sedona's iconic landscape on two wheels. With its diverse trails and breathtaking scenery, Sedona offers an unparalleled mountain biking experience suitable for adventurers of all levels. Get ready to immerse yourself in the exhilarating beauty of Sedona's rugged terrain as you pedal through this renowned mountain biking paradise.

Take your morning at a relaxed pace, soaking in the peaceful vibes before hitting the road for a scenic 3.5-hour drive down to Tucson, AZ. As you cruise along, let excitement build for the adventures ahead in this vibrant city. Once in Tucson, dive into its rich arts and culture scene, where history and creativity mingle effortlessly. Wander through the captivating exhibits at the Tucson Museum of Art, where every piece tells a story. Stroll down historic Fourth Avenue, where quirky shops and galleries promise delightful surprises around every corner. As you explore, let the breathtaking landscapes surrounding the city hint at the wonders awaiting you on tomorrow's adventure. From rugged deserts to majestic mountains, Tucson's natural beauty sets the stage for an unforgettable journey filled with awe and inspiration.

Let's dive into the wonders of Saguaro National Park, home to the majestic saguaro cacti, towering guardians of the desert landscape. With your trusty guide, you'll embark on a journey through this unique terrain, spanning from the Sonoran Desert to the Rincon Mountains. As you traverse the park, keep your senses sharp – you never know what treasures you might uncover. With over 1,100 species calling Saguaro National Park home, every step holds the potential for a fascinating encounter. Keep an eye out for the elusive gila monster or the gentle desert tortoise, blending seamlessly into their natural habitat. Considered two parks in one, Saguaro National Park offers a diverse tapestry of ecosystems to explore. Whether you're captivated by the rugged beauty of the desert or drawn to the serene majesty of the mountains, there's something here for everyone. Your adventure is tailored to suit the interests and abilities of your group, ensuring a truly unforgettable experience for all.
Today you’ll say good bye to the South West as you make your way to the Phonenix or Tucson airport for your departing flight.

tourName: Best of Washington holiday, USA
generalInfo: Embark on the Ultimate Washington Adventure. From the vibrant cityscape of Seattle to the serene trails of the Olympic Peninsula, immerse yourself in a blend of urban exploration and natural wonders. Traverse Bainbridge Island, delve into the depths of Olympic National Park, and paddle through the pristine waters of Freshwater Bay. Experience leisure in Seattle's iconic landmarks before ascending to the breathtaking heights of Mount Rainier. Depart with cherished memories of your unforgettable Washington adventure.

dayInfo.description: Embark on your exhilarating journey today! Arrive in Seattle at your leisure and dive into the bustling energy of Pike Place Market, where the aroma of freshly brewed coffee and vibrant displays of local produce await. Alternatively, ascend to the heights of the iconic Space Needle for panoramic views of the cityscape and surrounding mountains. As the day draws to a close, rendezvous with your knowledgeable guide to ensure every detail is finely tuned for the adventures that lie ahead.

Today marks the beginning of your exploration of the Olympic Peninsula, a land of natural beauty and cultural richness. Consider starting your day with a scenic ferry ride across the sound, where you'll land on Bainbridge Island. Here, quaint shops and inviting cafes beckon, offering a delightful opportunity to immerse yourself in the island's charm. Don't miss the chance to visit the Suquamish cultural center and museum, where you can delve into the fascinating heritage of the region's indigenous peoples. After indulging in the island's offerings, embark on a culinary journey at one of the locals' favored dining spots, just an hour's drive north. With appetites satisfied, prepare for a breathtaking afternoon amidst nature's grandeur at Hurricane Ridge. If luck is on your side and the skies are clear, be prepared to be mesmerized by the majestic vistas of the glacier-capped Olympic peaks. Let the beauty of the landscape inspire and rejuvenate you as you forge unforgettable memories on this enchanting day.

Get ready to kick-start your day bright and early with your friendly guide, setting the stage for an adventure-packed exploration. Today promises a diverse palette of landscapes that'll keep you enchanted from start to finish. Depending on the tides, we might kick things off or wind down at Ruby or Fourth Beach. Picture yourself wandering along the shore, uncovering hidden treasures in tide pools, and gazing in wonder at the majestic sea stacks dotting the coastline. But the excitement doesn't end there! Your afternoon will be spent delving into the lush embrace of the Hoh Rainforest, a true gem among nature's wonders. It's a place where life flourishes in every nook and cranny, and our expert guide will be there to share the magic with you. Get ready to be amazed as you stroll through towering trees, discovering the secrets of this thriving ecosystem. From the bustling activity underfoot to the serene beauty overhead, every moment promises to be a revelation, leaving you with memories to treasure for a lifetime.

Get ready for another thrilling day packed with excitement! Begin your adventure with a private sea kayaking tour of Freshwater Bay, where every paddle stroke brings you closer to the wonders of the aquatic world. Keep your eyes peeled for majestic bald eagles soaring overhead, playful otters frolicking in the waves, and graceful seabirds skimming the water's surface. After a delightful picnic lunch, it's time to head inland for an exhilarating mountain biking excursion along the scenic Elwha River. Whether you're a novice or intermediate paddler or rider, these activities are designed to suit all skill levels, ensuring everyone can join in the fun. Feel the rush of adrenaline as you navigate winding trails through pristine wilderness, surrounded by the sights and sounds of nature's playground. Get ready to create memories that'll last a lifetime on this action-packed day of exploration and adventure.

Return to Seattle for a day filled with exploration and discovery. Your knowledgeable guide will offer suggestions for exciting destinations or can organize a day trip tailored to the group's preferences. Dive into the vibrant energy of Pike Place Market, where the hustle and bustle of vendors and shoppers create an atmosphere like no other. Then, ascend the iconic Space Needle for breathtaking panoramic views of the city skyline and beyond. For a taste of artistic brilliance, wander through the enchanting Chihuly Garden and Glass, where vibrant glass sculptures ignite the imagination. Alternatively, delve into the world of music, film, and pop culture at the Museum of Pop Culture, where interactive exhibits and immersive experiences await. With so many possibilities, your day in Seattle promises to be a captivating blend of culture, history, and adventure.

Rise and shine bright and early for an exhilarating journey to the majestic heights of Tahoma, also known as Mount Rainier. Standing tall at 14,410 feet, Tahoma commands attention with its awe-inspiring presence, especially when she emerges from the swirling clouds to reveal her rugged beauty against the backdrop of the Pacific Northwest landscape. Your guided day trip will take you to the foot of this towering icon, offering a day of immersive hiking amidst pristine wilderness. Prepare to be enchanted by the lush alpine meadows, pristine lakes, and breathtaking vistas that await you in the Sunrise/Yakima Park area of the mountain. As you traverse the trails, you'll feel a profound connection to the natural world, rejuvenating both body and soul with every step. After an unforgettable day of exploration, your guide will whisk you back to Seattle, where you can unwind and reflect on your adventures over a delicious local dinner. Let the flavors of the Pacific Northwest tantalize your taste buds as you savor the memories of your remarkable journey to the heights of Tahoma.
Time to say goodbye to the Pacific Northwest and head back home with memories to last a lifetime!

tourName: Coastal California self drive holiday
generalInfo:
Over the years, countless films, photographs and guide books have attempted to capture the size, beauty and diversity of California. But nothing lives up to the reality of driving along the state’s winding coastline, gazing out over Yosemite Valley from Glacier Point, cycling across the Golden Gate Bridge or spotting your favourite celebrity’s star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

From the towering redwoods and fruitful vineyards of the north to the golden beaches and relaxed surfer lifestyle of the south, our specialists will help you plan your trip to California so you can uncover the state’s many sides. We visit the region regularly – particularly behind the wheel of a car – and will plan your ideal trip to California around your personal tastes and interests.

dayInfo.description: Today you begin your journey by boarding your international outbound flight to San Francisco. On arrival in San Francisco make your own way to your downtown hotel. The remainder of the day is free to relax after your flight. You could begin to explore the city, perhaps taking a stroll in Golden Gate Park or exploring the brightly decorated streets of Chinatown.

Today you are booked on a tour of the legendary Alcatraz prison. The ferry to Alcatraz Island leaves from Fisherman's Wharf. After you arrive you will walk around the prison with your own personal headsets (with voice overs from real ex-inmates) that tell you all about the history.

Another day to enjoy The City by the Bay. I would recommend cycling from Fisherman's Wharf across the Golden Gate Bridge today. Cycle across the bridge to the beautiful small town of Sausalito, have lunch there and catch the ferry across the bay back to Fisherman's Wharf.

Make your own way to your nearest car hire depot, where your car will be ready to collect. All insurances, road maps and a sat-nav are included. Your first drive of the trip is a simple two hour journey out of the city suburbs along the Pacific Coast Highway, through the undulating Santa Cruz Mountains and along the coastal highway to Monterey. The remainder of the day is free to explore the town at leisure; we can particularly recommend the scenic coastal drive around 17 Mile Drive, which passes through the pretty town of Carmel with its gated mansions and boutique shops.

Today you'll make your own way to the marina where you'll embark on an exciting three hour small group whale watching expedition. The area becomes a feeding ground for blue whales, Risso’s dolphins, humpback whales, northern right whale dolphins and orcas. The rest of the day is yours to explore Monterey - you could visit the aquarium, which has a big focus on marine conservation and features interactive exhibits about the area's marine life, or you could browse the shops, galleries and restaurants of historic Cannery Row.

Departing Monterey, drive around three hours south along the beautiful Pacific Coast Highway, past small villages and along cliff edges to Pismo Beach. Spend the afternoon at leisure strolling the beach area or relaxing by the pool.

Complete your journey with a three hour drive south to Los Angeles. En route, visit the beautiful Spanish mission town of Santa Barbara and sample wines at one of the vineyards that dot the area. Continue to Los Angeles, where you'll drop your car off at the depot, before making your own way to your hotel. The rest of the day is free for you to start exploring the city - you could pay a visit to the Griffith Observatory in the Hollywood Hills for views over the city and its famous Hollywood sign.
Today you can explore Hollywood, Beverly Hills and Santa Monica. Enjoy exploring the star's names on the Walk of Fame, do some shopping on Rodeo Drive or relax on the beautiful Santa Monica beach.
Tickets to go to Warner Brother Studios are included for today! Enjoy seeing where the magic of Hollywood is created at the world's busiest movie studio!
There's time this morning for some last-minute shopping and sightseeing before making your own way to the airport in time for your onward flight.
Arrive home today to complete your journey.

tourName: Colorado holiday, self drive tour, USA
placesVisited: Denver, Rocky Mountain National Park, Arches National Park, Monument Valley Navajo Tribal Park, Mesa Verde National Park, Durango to Silverton Steam train, Crested Butte, Vail
generalInfo:
Colorado: a state with a fascinating Native American history, and scenery that looks great out of the windshield, and even better when you step out of the car. This trip starts in its capital, Denver, at the edge of Rocky Mountain National Park, finishes in Vail, before you return to Denver.

A Colorado self drive tour is a great way to see the state – you’ll drive down scenic highway 70 with mountains at each turn in the road and drive through Monument Valley.

Not all the best sights can be seen from the road, which is why this trip also includes a day riding the Durango to Silverton Steam train along its narrow-gauge heritage railroad to the old mining town. You’ll also get tours of the national parks, including a Navajo-led tour that takes you to a traditional Hogan (dwelling place), where you’ll learn about the valley that is sacred in their culture.

Beautiful scenery aside, this trip also takes you to lovely mountain town pit-stops, including Durango, Crested Butte and Vail – to fuel up at diners, distilleries and dessert parlours after an amazing day’s driving.

dayInfo.description: International Outbound Flight - Denver. Today you will begin your journey by boarding your international outbound flight to Denver. On arrival in Denver make your own way to your downtown hotel. The remainder of the day is free to relax.

Denver. Spend a day exploring the highlights of Denver. Don't miss the Denver Art Museum, the Colorado History Museum or explore the city's many excellent art galleries. Alternatively, relax in Larimer Square and sample some excellent local cuisine while people watching.
Denver - Estes Park Today you will pick up your hire car from the airport and drive to Estes park. Relax in the park for the rest of the day.
Estes Park. Estes Park is the gateway to Rocky Mountain National Park. You can head into the park through the Beaver Meadows park entrance to explore.
Estes Park - Grand Junction. Today you will drive from Estes Park to Grand Junction along the lovely scenic highway 70 for your one night stop off.
Grand Junction - Moab. Drive west again today to Moab and the red rock landscape of Utah. Enjoy a day in the nearby Arches National Park.

Moab. Enjoy a half day tour of Arches National Park today seeing this phenomenal landscape with your guide. The rest of your day is at leisure to explore the park or the other parks such as Canyonlands nearby

Moab - Monument Valley Navajo Tribal Park. Drive from the wonderful Moab through to Monument Valley and Kayenta. Monument Valley encompasses the classic Wild West scenery of sandstone buttes, forbidding rock pinnacles and an endless expanse of drifting red sands that have been immortalised in the early Wild West films. Take some time to relax and take in the scenery.

Monument Valley Navajo Tribal Park. Another day for enjoying the incredible scenery that Southwest American has to offer. Today you will experience one of the Navajo led tours into the Valley where you can see Navajo culture which is largely untainted by tourism. You may get to visit a traditional Hogan and hear some of the folklore tales handed down to them by the generations before them.

Monument Valley Navajo Tribal Park - Mesa Verde National Park. Today you will head east from Monument Valley and travel to Mesa Verde to see the remains of the homes that were inhabited in the 1250s by ancestral puebleons!

Mesa Verde National Park - Durango. Mesa Verde to Durango is a short drive today. When you get to the lovely frontier town, make sure you check out the charming boutique shops and the Strater Hotel's bar for a slice of the real wild west!

Durango: Today you will make your way in plenty of time to the train station where you will board the wonderful Durango to Silverton Steam train. Explore the incredible scenery of centrai Colorado today - sights which can't be viewed by car!

Durango - Crested Butte. The drive today is stunning as you make your way north to Crested Butte! This is a lovely mountain town, and it's well worth stopping at the Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park.

Crested Butte. Today you can enjoy Crested Butte. You may like to take a drive out to the local mountains and valleys around the town, take a trip to the distillery or just relax in town and wander around the lovely shops.

Crested Butte - Vail. Today you can relax on your lovely journey north east from Crested Butte to Vail. On arrival in Vail you might like to explore the beautiful local area, a great spot for photos of the incredible mountains that surround you.
Vail. Enjoy a day at leisure in Vail. Explore the shops, go for a walk in the wonderful nearby countryside or just enjoy your luxury 5* hotel before your flight home tomorrow.
Vail - International Return Flight. Tomorrow you will drive back to Denver and return your car before boarding your onward flight.
International Return Flight. Arrive home today to complete your journey.

tourName: Deep South Delta Blues tour in America
placesVisited: Atlanta, Birmingham, Civil Rights Institute, New Orleans, French Quarter, Bourbon Street, Garden District, Mississippi Riverboat Dinner Cruise, Jean Lafitte Nature Preserve, Houmas House Plantation and Gardens, Natchez, Clarksdale, Hopson Plantation, Robert Johnson’s Crossroads, Tupelo, Memphis, Graceland, Sun Studio, Gibson Guitar Factory, Nashville
generalInfo:
Discover the cultural landscape that gave birth to the blues, country and rock ‘n’ roll on this tour along the mighty Mississippi. Days move a little slower in the Deep South, as you pass time with a sweet tea or a Jack and Coke, taking in the sights and sounds of Music Row in Nashville, Beale Street in Memphis and along Bourbon Street in New Orleans. You also savour authentic cuisine and enjoy Southern hospitality as you float down the Mississippi on a riverboat cruise.

From May 2026, this adventure is only available as a private departure. Contact us to find out more.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to the cultural melting pot of the Deep South, New Orleans, otherwise known as the Big Easy. The eclectic mix of European, Creole and Cajun cultures manifests in every aspect of the architecture, cuisine and musical scene. Depending on the group flight arrival time, a welcome briefing may be held this evening or tomorrow morning. Accommodation: Wyndham New Orleans - French Quarter (or similar)

This morning, our leader takes us on a guided historical walking tour around the French Quarter, the oldest neighbourhood in New Orleans. We’ll walk down historic streets, seeing different architectural styles of iconic homes, Jackson Square and listen to jazz as we learn about the history of this unique city. The afternoon is free for individual sight-seeing, then we come together in the evening to enjoy an included dinner cruise on the Mississippi River, dining on delicious local cuisine influenced by the myriad cultures that make up Louisiana. Accommodation: Wyndham New Orleans - French Quarter (or similar)

Today is free for you to take in the sights and sounds of Bourbon Street, relax in the Garden District or absorb more of the ambience of the French Quarter. There are several optional tours available, including a thrilling alligator swamp tour, during which you travel north to the town of Slidell to board the swamp boat for two hours, navigating on the West Pearl River and into the Honey Island Swamp. There are over a million alligators in Louisiana, so keep an eye out! You may also see turtles and exotic birds among the cypress trees of the swamp. Your tour leader will be able to help with any reservations you wish to make. There is plenty to do in New Orleans come evening, not least enjoying some of the many live performances that take place nightly. This includes Preservation Hall, where top jazz musicians play every evening to a small audience in an intimate space – be prepared to wait in line. There will also be the chance to step out of the city and explore the wild river swamplands of Louisiana, where you can head out by boat beneath the cypress trees in search of alligators. See the Extra Expenses section of our trip notes for more information about optional activities. Accommodation: Wyndham New Orleans - French Quarter (or similar)

This morning, we visit Melrose Mansion within Natchez National Historical Park, completed in the mid-1800s and now one of the best-preserved estates in the Deep South. A guided tour of the mansion and self-guided tours of the grounds, which includes slave quarters, stables and a carriage house, provide an in-depth understanding of the region's deep-rooted links to slavery. Departing the estate, we follow the river road north to the first established settlement on the Mississippi. Natchez, the original capital of the Mississippi Territory, was at the heart of the trade in enslaved people and is the birthplace of the Mississippi riverboat. There is free time to wander the historic district where there are more than 50 antebellum homes and historic churches. Also worthy of a visit is the Under the Hill area made famous by Mark Twain or discover one of the most interesting cemeteries in the South. Accommodation: Guest House Natchez (or similar)

Next up is Clarksdale and the Hopson Plantation, the former home of legendary blues pianist Pinetop Perkins. It is also where they tested the International Harvester automated cotton picker. Your leader will tell you the history, explaining the system of sharecropping and the evolution of the cotton industry. Clarksdale is also home to the Crossroads, where legend says blues musician Robert Johnson sold his soul to the devil. Within the town itself is the Delta Blues Museum, a shrine of blues artefacts and memorabilia, plus actor Morgan Freeman's Ground Zero Blues Club. Red's is definitely worth a visit for live music: an authentic juke joint showcasing the real heart of the South. Accommodation: Hampton Inn Clarksdale (or similar)

Today we cross into Tennessee. Near the Mississippi River, Memphis has a long and colourful past. Legendary forefathers such as Louis Armstrong, Muddy Waters and BB King put Beale Street on the musical map. Outside of music, the National Civil Rights Museum is located in the former Lorraine Hotel, at the site where Martin Luther King was assassinated. We pay a visit to understand better this vital part of US, and global, history. Accommodation: Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown or Comfort Inn Memphis (or similar)

A highlight of your stay in Memphis is an included excursion to Graceland, the home of Elvis Presley. We spend several hours taking an audio-guided tour of the mansion, seeing the King of Rock ‘n’ Roll’s gold records, jewelled jumpsuits and famous Jungle Room with its green shagged carpets. We can pay our respects in the Meditation Garden, where Elvis and members of his family have been laid to rest. We also stop by Sun Studio, which opened in 1950 and is where many great names have passed through, from Howlin' Wolf to Johnny Cash. Accommodation: Crowne Plaza Memphis Downtown or Comfort Inn Memphis (or similar)

We leave Memphis today and head to Nashville, the undisputed capital of country music. Home to the Country Music Hall of Fame and the Wildhorse Saloon, Nashville is the perfect opportunity to try line dancing (select nights only). Broadway is lined with honky-tonks and intimate live music venues playing all genres of music. Accommodation: La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham Nashville (or similar)

Today is free to explore Nashville, the capital of Tennessee and the largest city in the state. On the banks of the Cumberland River, it was established as a port by settlers in 1779 but is best known for music. There are many venues to visit, but most famous of all is the Opry House, 15mi (24km) east of the city. This historic concert venue is synonymous with country music, hosting regular live performances that showcase the best of the genre. Book before you arrive to avoid missing out as these shows are popular. See the Extra Expenses section of our Trip Notes for more information about optional activities. Accommodation: La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham Nashville (or similar)
Our tour of the Deep South ends in Nashville. If you’d like to spend extra time exploring this country music Mecca, please speak to your sales representative.

tourName: Family rafting holiday on the Salmon River, Idaho, USA
generalInfo:
No other river in the world sets a better stage for family rafting trips than Idaho's famous Salmon River of No Return. Warm water and hot summer weather coupled with camping on expansive white sand beaches make for the ideal family rafting holiday. Fun, intermediate rapids and classic scenery of the American West make this a family superb adventure holiday for ages five and up.

Your kids won't want this family holiday to end and we promise it will be the highlight of your trip to the USA. As you raft during the day, we stop to visit sites of interest like Indian rock art sites, pioneer homesteads and natural highlights. Trips are staffed with our signature River Jester who leads nature-oriented games and activities. Each evening a special kids’ meal is served, followed by an adult meal, and kids are welcome at both. As the sun sets a blazing campfire warms the group under a star-studded sky.

In the morning a world of wonder awaits and the kids enjoy playing with new friends. Parents enjoy the quality time for everyone, undistracted and unplugged from the world while being immersed in nature. These are wild canyons where you are likely to see deer, river otter, soaring eagles and other wildlife. During the day you choose to ride in oar-powered rafts where a guide does the rowing, or participate in a paddle raft where everyone has a paddle and works as a team, or take your own inflatable kayak. One of the great things about a whitewater rafting holiday is that there’s a level of excitement suitable for everyone.

We've been running family rafting trips for over 35 years on the best whitewater rafting rivers in the American West. Our guides are trained to share their knowledge of the natural and cultural history

All gear is provided and no experience is necessary. A cargo raft travels ahead and sets up a luxury wilderness camp each day replete with dining tables and chairs, kitchen and tents. When you arrive at camp just carry your personal gear to your tent. Trips are staffed with one guide for every three to four guests, so you are assured of the finest in personal attention and service.

We choreograph everything to create a perfect recipe for a family rafting holiday that sets the high watermark for a meaningful, educational and inspiring family holiday that will leave everyone with big grins and sad to say good-bye.

This family holiday is easily combined with other activities in the area like a stay at our own Rocky Mountain guest ranch, visits to Oregon, Montana or other parts of Idaho and much more.

dayInfo.description: Your holiday begins in Lewiston, Idaho where you meet where you meet our Team Leader and our River Jester™ at the Hells Canyon Grand Hotel at 7:00pm PST for a one-hour orientation meeting to answer last-minute questions. You also receive your waterproof gear bags. Dinner is on your own.

We meet at 7:30am for a two-hour bus ride to the put-in point for your family rafting trip near Whitebird, Idaho. On the way we visit the Nez Perce National Historical Park for an introduction to the native peoples who lived along the Salmon River for thousands of years. We then continue, passing through the town of Lapwai where many Nez Perce Today celebrate their heritage living on the Nez Perce Reservation. We arrive at the put-in by mid-morning. Summer here is typically dry and hot, with daytime temperatures in the 90’s and nights in the 60’s. Before we board the rafts, our staff prepares you with a thorough safety briefing that includes information on how to ride in a raft, how to paddle, how to swim through rapids, and other advice for the days ahead. Once this is complete everyone chooses a raft - paddle, oar-powered or inflatable kayak and we begin floating on the river. The Salmon River Canyons is a trip with “pool and drop” characteristics which means there is a long pool of calm water followed by a rapid. The trip begins with some fun rapids that are the perfect introduction to a successful whitewater holiday. When we stop for lunch, some guides prepare the meal while one provides a “camp orientation” to explain how we minimize our impact on the river. ROW adheres to "Leave No Trace" camping ethics, so you'll learn where to wash up, how the toilet system works, where you brush your teeth, put trash, and more. By the times this is done lunch is ready and it’s time to make a sandwich and enjoy the open-air dining experience. Later in the afternoon, around 4:30 or so, we arrive at camp with plenty of free time for play. You might want to hike, fish, read or just plain relax. Our River Jester™ has fun activities planned for the children. This could be a nature walk, a game at the river’s edge, or an arts and crafts project. Some kids may want to simply build sand castles and play in the water. Parents are welcome to join in, or to relax in their own way. Hors d’oeuvres are served as the sun disappears over the canyon rim around 6:00pm along with the kids’ dinner. The adult's dinner is served an hour or so later and kids are welcome to join. After dinner a campfire is lit and we start an evening of laughter and sharing. Soon the night sky darkens and we offer an astronomy lesson or tell stories to send everyone to bed with sweet dreams.

The smell of fresh-brewed coffee and tea awakes you, followed by breakfast which is served around 7:30. As we clean up the kitchen, you pack up your personal gear and we load the rafts and leave camp around 9:30. It’s a family rafting day full of rapids, sun and dramatic scenery. Before long we stop to visit a Native American rock art site, created by the original inhabitants of this rugged land. These are the people who came before today’s Nez Perce tribe. The Nez Perce were once the most populous tribe in the Pacific Northwest and their homeland covered millions of acres including settlements along the Snake, Salmon and Clearwater rivers. Their life depended on these rivers from which they harvested thousands of salmon that were both a part of their food supply as well as spiritual nurturing. In the cooler months they lived in “pit houses” along this section of the Salmon River and we stop to see some places where you can see evidence of these. The river enters the first of four canyons, this one called “Green Canyon” and kids and adults alike shout with excitement as we paddle through Wright Way and Demon’s Drop. Before long we stop for lunch on a big beach, perfect for swimming and beach games. The afternoon has some more rapids, quiet drifting and the chance of seeing soaring eagles. We make camp on a big white sand beach, and after dinner sit around the evening campfire and marvel at a sky filled with brilliant stars and no light pollution.

Our rafting holiday continues through “Cougar Canyon” and “Snowhole Canyon” for a fantastic day of whitewater rafting fun. Frolicking, splashy rapids include Bunghole, Half and Half, the Gobbler, Bodacious Bounce and others that are sure to make everyone smile. One of the most interesting aspects of human history unique to Idaho and the Salmon River is the story of the Chinese miners who came here in the latter 19th century. Gold was discovered in the area in 1861 and Chinese miners worked and provided support services for the mining camps. By 1870, 25 percent of Idaho's population was Chinese and by the 1880’s some had set up placer mining camps along this stretch of the Salmon River. Using hard labor, rocker boxes and other simple hydraulics these Chinese miners moved tons of earth to find gold. In their camps, they built small rock houses, which we visit today. After a full replete with learning and fun, we arrive in camp. The hot weather and warm water makes it likely that everyone will jump in for a swim. We often set up games such as volleyball, horseshoes and such, or lead a hike up a nearby mountain for stunning views. Summer evenings in Idaho are long, with darkness arriving after 9:30pm in July and early August. As the night gets dark, the crackling campfire and fresh mountain air will help you sleep like a baby.

Another day with fun rapids and spectacular Western scenery and if lucky, we might see playful river otters swimming in the river. There’s time to jump in for a swim and even float through a mild rapid. Those fishing may catch trout and bass. Birdwatchers are likely to spot golden eagles and falcons. Your worries seem thousands of miles away as river time settles into our rhythm and our souls. After lunch the river enters “Blue Canyon,” named for the bluish/black tone of the igneous rock that forms this steep-walled landscape. In this canyon the river is forced into a narrower channel and a long series of cascading rapids make for a thrilling afternoon. We splash through the Devil’s Slide, Sluice Box, Checkerboard and Eye of the Needle, all rapids that make for great stories around the campfire. Tonight’s camp is near the confluence of the Salmon and Snake River and is once again on a massive white sand beach. Only undammed, free-flowing rivers like the Salmon are able to create natural beaches like this as ground-up rock is free to travel as sediment downriver, settling to create these beautiful oases of glistening sand. Once a river has a dam, these sediments are trapped behind its concrete walls and this then stops the formation of sand beaches.

Early in the morning we pass the confluence of the Salmon and Snake Rivers – a powerful place where the legendary Salmon “River of No Return” ends its journey and her waters mix with those of the mighty Snake River at the lower end of Hells Canyon. Once we are on the Snake, we float on roughly twice the volume of water as the Salmon alone. This marks the boundary between states and from this point on Idaho is on the right while Oregon or Washington are on the left. We enjoy some more big waves and laughter-filled rides through some rapids, along with some long stretches of flat water. As we travel downstream, we pass the original Nez Perce trail descending down the canyon to a river crossing that was used for centuries by the Nez Perce as they travelled east from the Wallowa Mountains (in today’s northeast corner of Oregon) to the plains further west. We stop for another bountiful lunch on a sandy beach and then, after a few more miles of magnificent scenery reach the take-out point around 3:00pm. The rafts are unloaded and personal gear taken to the waiting bus. It’s a short 45-minute ride to the hotel to enjoy a hot shower and then we meet for a hosted farewell dinner.

If you drove to Lewiston your car is waiting for you. If you came by airplane the hotel shuttle will transport you to the Lewiston airport or you can take a taxi to the Spokane, Washington airport, two hours north.

tourName: Lake Tahoe and Yosemite tour, USA
generalInfo: Bookended by stops in two bustling cities, this seven-day adventure takes you through some of the incredibly diverse landscapes California’s national parks have to offer. Soaring Sequoias that’ll make your jaw drop and Yosemite’s dramatic waterfalls will leave you awe-inspired – all within the same state! As you take in the big sites, you’ll have a local leader filling you in on all the small details, with no story going untold as you leave no stone unturned on this naturally epic escapade.

dayInfo.title: Las Vegas.
dayInfo.description: Welcome to Nevada! Las Vegas will be your gateway to the grandeur of the Golden State. Your adventure begins with a welcome meeting at 5 pm, giving you plenty of time to bathe in Vegas’ glow. It’s recommended that you arrive a day or two early to really experience the city, allowing time to do the classics (think casinos, drive-through weddings and live shows) as well as scratching below the surface to see Las Vegas’ diverse neighbourhoods and thriving arts scene.

dayInfo.title: Las Vegas to Visalia.
dayInfo.description: Leaving Sin City in your dust, you’ll road trip across state lines and through the Mojave Desert today, then around to Sequoia National Park. It’s a long drive, but it’ll give you the chance to see the changing geography of the American west – watch on as the desert gives way to the peaks of the southern Sierras. Settle into your accommodation near Sequoia National Park in the afternoon, and then head out for an included dinner at a local restaurant with your group.

dayInfo.title: Sequoia National Park.
dayInfo.description: Today is simply about seeing the best of the USA’s Sequoia National Park. After breakfast, you’ll embark on leader-led walks around Sequoia, driving from stop to stop as you get to feel small next to the staggering size of General Sherman, the Giant Forest and other specimens of Sequoia’s towering timber. You may even drive through a tree at Tunnel Log, peer into Tharp’s Log and spot marmots, black bears and recently re-introduced bighorn sheep.

dayInfo.title: Yosemite National Park .
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you’ll hit the highway headed for the world-famous Yosemite National Park. To start, get acquainted with the awe-inspiring Yosemite Valley during a guided hike. Strewn with dramatic waterfalls, gigantic granite outcrops and lush meadows, this is one of the most spectacular spots in the country. Your leader will also teach you about the ecologically diverse landscape along the way. After sunset, you’ll join a Naturalist from the Yosemite Conservancy for a guided stargazing program. The park’s minimal light pollution makes it an excellent place to see the stars while learning about astronomy, constellations and local lore. For the next two nights, you'll be staying in a hotel just a few minutes from the park's main entrance.

dayInfo.title: Yosemite National Park.
dayInfo.description: Today, Yosemite is all yours to explore! In the morning there’ll be leader-led walks around some of the park’s best trails. If it’s a clear day you may also drive up to Glacier Point for a view you won’t soon forget, looking down over the valley and across to the iconic Half Dome. The afternoon is yours to fill how you’d like. You might choose to hike along the breathtaking Mist Trail with its many fabulous views, hire a bicycle and pedal along some of the 12 miles of designated (and flat) path or immerse yourself in the park’s history at the Ahwahnee Hotel. Once you’ve seen the sights, the day will be capped off with a pizza picnic in the park for dinner.

dayInfo.title: San Francisco.
dayInfo.description: After saying fond farewells to Yosemite, you’ll head west to vibrant San Francisco. Stop to do a walk over the iconic Golden Gate Bridge, and then check in to your hotel for the night. At sunset, you can hit the water for an optional catamaran cruise around the bay, with views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz Island – this is the perfect farewell to a sun kissed Californian adventure. If you like, head out with your fellow travellers for one last dinner.

dayInfo.title: San Francisco .
dayInfo.description: With no activities planned today, your adventure ends this morning. If you’d like to stay longer, just speak to your booking agent.

tourName: Las Vegas to San Francisco tour USA
generalInfo:
The West Coast is a true treasure trove of magnificent scenery, stunning cities and gorgeous weather. This West Coast America tour includes a whole series of highlights. Marvel at the natural wonder of the Grand Canyon, stroll Californian city streets and experience Vegas in all its glory. What's more - there's epic trips on Route 66!

We stay in a mixture of accommodation with city centre hostels and a luxury hotel in Vegas.

Allow us to let you discover America on this action-packed and exciting tour!

dayInfo.description: Welcome to the USA!: Welcome to the USA – and to the first epic chapter of your West Coast America adventure! After spending your morning at your own leisure in Vegas, you’ll meet your Adventure Leader and the rest of your group at the entrance to Luxor Hotel’s Aurora Bar in the afternoon. This is where the journey truly begins: meet your new travel buddies, get the low-down on the days ahead, and hear all the tips you need to stay safe and have the time of your life in the States. Then it’s time to hit the Strip! Soak up the electric energy, neon lights, and non-stop buzz of Las Vegas before sitting down for a group meal at Café Hollywood – a retro American diner with all the classics. Afterwards, enjoy the legendary Bellagio Water Show, where towering fountains burst into life with music and light – a true Vegas icon and star of countless movies. For those who love a night out, you’re in good hands! Our local Adventure Leaders can point you towards some of Vegas’s best nightlife…

Route 66 Legends, Seligman, & Campfire S’mores in Arizona: This morning, you’ll hit the road for the next stop on your West Coast adventure – but not before ticking off a couple of absolute icons. First up: the legendary Las Vegas sign, before stopping at Trader Joe’s – LA’s favourite grocery store – to load up on snacks and supplies for the day, then it’s onwards to Route 66! Lunch offers a couple of fun options! Opt for a chilled Trader Joe’s picnic at Locomotive Park in Kingman, Arizona, home to the mighty Steam Engine #3759. This historic beauty was gifted to the city back in 1957 by the Santa Fe Railway Company, and you can even climb aboard for a closer look. Alternatively, choose to grab a classic Route 66 meal at the colourful and retro Mr. D’z Route 66 Diner just steps away. Next, we’ll visit the rustic Seligman – the birthplace of Route 66 and the real-life inspiration behind Pixar’s Cars. Wander around, soak up the retro Americana vibes, and grab some iconic snaps before hopping back on the bus bound for Williams. Tonight, you’ll check into an incredible glamping site, settling into your cosy cabin before heading out for a BBQ dinner with your travel buddies at the Cruiser’s Route 66 Café. Afterwards, it’s back to the campsite to gather around the fire and tuck into the ultimate road-trip treat: s’mores, of course!

Las Vegas & Grand Canyon: This morning, it’s off to one of the seven natural wonders of the world and a true highlight of this West Coast America Tour – the Grand Canyon! You’ll have some free time to take in the majesty of this 277-mile geological wonder, with the opportunity to snap some Insta-worthy photos on the Southern Rim or embark on one of the unforgettable hikes. We recommend following the Rim Trail at your own pace—don’t forget to bring plenty of water! In the mid-afternoon, we’ll regroup at the Hopi House next to El Tovar Hotel and make our way back to Vegas by bus, where you’ll have the evening to enjoy as you wish. Here are some top suggestions from our local experts on how to spend your evening in Las Vegas: For the music fans – head to Fremont Street in Downtown Las Vegas, where you’ll find plenty of live music concerts (most of them for free too)! For the adrenaline junkies – take on the SlotZilla, an 11-story slot machine-inspired zipline attraction on Fremont Street (starting from $49). For the ever-so-slightly crazy – try Nacho Daddy’s Scorpion Shot, a masterful blend of tasty spirits and exotic ingredients, topped off with a real, edible scorpion (yep, you heard right). The MOB Museum (starting from $29.95) – a nonprofit organisation dedicated to advancing the public’s understanding of organized crime’s history and its impact on American society. The Neon Museum (starting from $28) – an outdoor experience that brings the story of Las Vegas to life, featuring iconic neon signs and exhibits that illuminate the city’s rich history. For karaoke lovers – head to the Star-Wars-themed Millennium Fandom Bar, where you can immerse yourself in a world of karaoke and fandom.

Santa Monica Sightseeing & Sunset Beach Stroll: This morning, we’re off to the next stop on your West Coast America Tour – Los Angeles! Transfer by bus to arrive in Santa Monica in the early afternoon where your Adventure Leader will meet you, before checking into the Santa Monica hostel. You’ll have some free time to wander the iconic 3rd Street Promenade at your own pace – think street performers, cool shops, and laid-back Cali vibes. When hunger strikes, grab dinner wherever takes your fancy; your Adventure Leader will have plenty of top local recommendations for you! As the evening sets in, we’ll regroup for an unmissable activity: a sunset stroll along Santa Monica Beach followed by an arcade challenge on the legendary Santa Monica Pier!

Sunset Boulevard & Griffith Observatory: This morning, we’re hitting the heart of LA! Take the metro to the iconic Sunset Boulevard and stroll among the stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. For lunch, we’ll all grab a classic California treat together with a group meal at In-N-Out Burger, before enjoying some free time to explore – maybe the Hollywood Film Museum, the Wax Museum, or a spot of souvenir shopping. In the early evening, get ready for an unmissable adventure: a hike from Griffith Park up to the legendary Griffith Observatory! Along the way, snap epic views of the Hollywood sign and arrive just in time to watch the sun dip behind the City of Angels. As you make your way back down, the city lights will sparkle below – a true main-character moment – before returning to your Santa Monica hostel.

Beach Volleyball Lesson, Flight to San Fran, & Yosemite Bug: This morning, we’re up and at ‘em with another unmissable activity: volleyball on Santa Monica beach! Your group will get your very own coach and learn how to bump, set, and spike. Then, it’s time to transfer to the final stop on our West Coast Adventure – San Fran! We’ll head to the airport and take a speedy flight from LA to San Francisco. Touch down in San Francisco and meet your Adventure Leader, who’ll whisk you straight into the wild beauty of Yosemite country. Settle into the beautiful Yosemite Bug Mountain Resort – a cosy, rustic base surrounded by epic forests, fresh alpine air, and the unmistakable magic of Yosemite on your doorstep. As evening settles in, gather with your group for a tasty meal at the June Bug Café, then head up the mountain for some incredible stargazing. With the Milky Way overhead and Yosemite’s wilderness around you, it’s the perfect way to kick off your time in one of America’s most legendary landscapes.

Columbia Rock Hike & Merced River Plunge: This morning, we’ll check out of Yosemite Bug Resort and hop on the YARTS bus straight into the heart of Yosemite National Park for an unmissable day of adventure. With your expert guide, you’ll take on the rewarding hike up to Columbia Rock along the Yosemite Falls Trail, where sweeping Sierra Nevada views make every step worth it! Don’t worry, we’ll stop and refuel with a picnic lunch beneath towering cliffs and pine forests, then cool off with an exhilarating plunge into the Merced River – the perfect way to wrap up your Yosemite experience. In the afternoon, ride the YARTS bus back to the resort, grab your bags, and hit the road to San Francisco, stopping for dinner en route before checking into your hostel for a well-earned rest.

Cycle across Golden Gate Bridge & Optional Alcatraz Island Tour: We kick off our final day with an absolute must-do: a bike ride across the legendary Golden Gate Bridge! Spend the morning cycling past some of San Francisco’s most iconic sights, taking in the views and snapping those postcard-perfect shots, before rolling back to Pier 39. Sadly, this marks the end of your West Coast America Tour! But if you’re up for one last adventure, you can opt to hop on a ferry to the infamous Alcatraz Island and explore ‘The Rock’ for a glimpse inside the legendary prison. Still sticking around for the evening? Let’s make it a night to remember – ride a cable car to Union Square, catch a Giants baseball game, or just soak up the buzzing San Fran nightlife one last time!

tourName: Maine and Massachusetts self drive holiday
placesVisited: Tailor made self drive route according to your interests, Explore Maine and Massachusetts at your own pace, Boston, Kennebunkport, Portland, Lincolnville, Bar Harbor, Acadia National Park, Stay in hotels with strong community ethos
generalInfo:
Touring the New England region of northeast America on a self drive holiday is delightful, allowing you to take your time exploring the landscapes, communities and historic sites along the way. Our Massachusetts self drive holiday begins in Boston, home to the Red Sox (ball game tickets can be arranged!), the Freedom Trail, and a thriving market where you can browse the stalls of local vendors for lunch.

Picking up your hire car, you can then follow a route through Kennebunkport, perhaps pausing for a walk in the Rachel Carson National Wildlife Refuge; Portland (famed for its cuisine), and the charming seaside town of Bar Harbor on Mount Desert Island. By now your trip has become a Maine self drive holiday, and you can enjoy wandering these quintessential New England small towns and beaches.

Your pre-booked accommodation is at a series of hotels that have been carefully chosen for their community ethos. One might support local literacy programs, another conservation initiatives in Acadia National Park. It means your trip has a clear benefit to the places you visit.
With a self drive tour, what you do with your time is up to you. You just need to get from A to B each day.

So you might spend an afternoon browsing independent bookshops in Bar Harbor, a day hiking the trails of Acadia National Park or Wells Reserve, or pass a few hours with a tempting foodie tour around Portland’s Old Town. Whatever you do, the freedom of a self drive tour is undoubtedly the finest way to discover Maine and Massachusetts.

dayInfo.description: Today, you begin your journey by boarding your international outbound flight to Boston. Upon arrival, make your way to your hotel and spend the evening at leisure. If its warm out, take a stroll to the harbourfront and enjoy your first taste of New England seafood overlooking the water.

You have the day at leisure to explore the city on foot or on bicycle. Walk the Freedom Trail to discover the city’s rich history, take a visit to Public Market for lunch where you can support local vendors or head down to the waterfront for a cruise if the weather permits. We can also arrange excellent tasting tours of the North End, so you can get a better understanding of the melting pot of cultures in Boston.

You have another day at leisure to enjoy the city of Boston. Take the subway to Boston Common for a leisurely stroll and to visit the well-known ‘Make Way For Ducklings’ sculpture. If you wish, we can arrange tickets for you to see the Boston Red Sox at Fenway Park tonight.

Leaving the city behind, pick up your rental car and drive north along the scenic Route 1 towards Kennebunkport. We recommend stopping off in Ogunquit for a walk along Marginal Way. The views are beautiful and this makes for a nice way to stretch your legs after a car journey. Enjoy lunch and maybe an ice cream on the beach before continuing on to Kennebunkport. Spend the evening relaxing at your hotel or head into town for an evening stroll.

Today, you have a full day to explore the Kennebunks. With plenty to see and do, you may find it difficult to whittle down your options. We suggest spending a morning walking the trails at Rachel Carson’s Wildlife Refuge or the Wells Reserve at Laudholm Farm, followed by an afternoon at the beach.

From Kennebunkport, continue north along Route 1 to Lincolnville. Stop off in Portland, voted USA’s Foodiest Small Town, for a comprehensive food tour around the Old Town and visit the Portland Head Light. You will then drive onto Lincolnville, another Maine small town that epitomises quintessential New England; with sweeping beaches, independent boutiques and galleries and numerous walking trails.

Next stop is Mount Desert Island and the town of Bar Habor, just a half an hour drive from Acadia National Park. As the base for exploring the park, many visitors flock to Bar Harbor during the summer months. Independently own stores selling Maine blueberries and maple syrup line the streets, as well as quaint cafes serving up hearty breakfasts to set hikers up for the day.

Your first full day in Acadia National Park is best spent exploring the many hiking trails. We can suggest a number of different options for easy, moderate and difficult trails, depending on your individual requirements. Driving the Park Loop Road is part of the fun, and the hikes often begin from small parking lots dotted around the island. Whether you chose to take a leisurely walk around Jordan Pond, or embark on a challenging hike to the top of Acadia Mountain, the magic of Acadia is bound to amaze you.

Your second day in Bar Harbor can be spent returning to the park for those looking to do more hiking, or can be spent perusing the bookshops and gift stores of the town, followed by a tour out on a lobster boat with a local fisherman. This is an excellent way to see the coastline from the water and you may spot seals, whales and birdlife as you learn about the history of lobster-catching in the state of Maine.
Leave behind the beauty of Acadia National Park and Mount Desert Island and make your way to Bangor airport for your overnight flight home.
Arrive home today to complete your journey.

tourName: Maine self drive holiday, USA
generalInfo: Journey across the Best of Coastal Maine in nine days! This immersive trip unveils the natural splendors of Acadia National Park, the quaint charm of Bar Harbor, the scenic allure of Boothbay Harbor, and the vibrant energy of Portland. Guests will begin with an intimate sunset Windjammer cruise, where complimentary beverages are a toast to the beginning of their extraordinary adventure. The following day, early risers will ascend Cadillac Mountain for a sunrise spectacle, an exclusive moment as they become among the first to witness the sun's touch on the East Coast. After a wildlife cruise, the journey continues to Boothbay Harbor, offering leisure to explore this picturesque town or visit the Coastal Maine Botanical Gardens. Guests will kayak along the rocky coast, providing an intimate encounter with seals and marine life. Departing for Portland, they’ll experience the authentic world of lobstering, participating in hauling traps and savoring the opportunity to cook their catch. The final stretch explores Cape Elizabeth, with coastal walks, a lighthouse tour, and breathtaking views of the Atlantic. This is a sample itinerary and can be customized to the clients' interests, abilities, timeline, and budget!

dayInfo.description: Embark on your Mount Desert Island escapade as you step into the charming town of Bar Harbor. Wander through its quaint streets, brimming with local shops and coastal charm, immersing yourself in the island's unique atmosphere. As the day transitions into evening, indulge in an exclusive experience aboard a Windjammer cruise. Feel the sea breeze caress your skin as you sip on complimentary beverages, toasting to the beginning of your unforgettable journey against the backdrop of a stunning sunset over the Atlantic.

Embark on an adventure into the heart of Acadia National Park, a true gem of northern New England boasting towering rocky headlands that kiss the sky along the Atlantic coast. Join forces with your expert guide for an immersive journey through this natural wonderland. Prepare to be enchanted as your guide tailors the day's itinerary to suit your desires, offering a plethora of opportunities for scenic sightseeing and exhilarating hikes, carefully curated to match your preferences. Amidst the breathtaking landscapes, pause for a delightful picnic lunch lovingly prepared by your knowledgeable guide, adding a savory touch to your exploration of this unparalleled wilderness.

Are you ready for an unforgettable experience? Today, we invite you to embark on a journey to Cadillac Mountain, renowned for its breathtaking sunrises that mark the beginning of each day along the East Coast. As the first point in the United States touched by sunlight for much of the year, it holds a special allure for early risers like yourself. Your guide will pick you up bright and early, armed with freshly brewed coffee, as you ascend to the summit of this iconic peak, the highest point on the eastern seaboard. Should you seek an added dose of adventure, consider joining for a sunrise hike, where you will ascend to the peak's elevation of 1,530 feet, witnessing nature's spectacle unfold before us. Following this awe-inspiring experience, the remainder of the day is yours to tailor as you see fit. Whether you prefer a moment of relaxation in your accommodations, indulging in shopping excursions within charming Bar Harbor, or embarking on a leisurely bike ride through the park's picturesque landscapes, the possibilities abound. The choice is yours to make.

Set sail on a captivating voyage to uncover some of Maine's most enchanting inhabitants. Step aboard a boat, destined for the pristine waters of Frenchman Bay, where adventure awaits. As we glide across the glistening bay, prepare to be mesmerized by the charismatic puffins that call these islands home. Keep your eyes peeled for glimpses of other coastal treasures, including Harbor and Gray Seals, Razorbills, Arctic Terns, Roseate Terns, Common Terns, Guillemots, Cormorants, and majestic Bald Eagles soaring overhead. Our journey will lead us to Petit Mann Island, adorned with the historic Petit Mann Lighthouse, standing tall as the second tallest in Maine. Immerse yourself in the rich maritime history of this captivating locale as our expert guide unveils its secrets, all while tailoring the experience to your interests and schedule. Prepare for an expedition brimming with wildlife encounters and nautical wonders, promising memories to be cherished for a lifetime.

Today is all about you! Take the morning at your own pace—whether that means unwinding with some downtime or exploring the charms of the town. Maybe you're drawn to the serene beauty of the Coastal Maine Botanical Gardens, where you can lose yourself in the colors and fragrances of nature. Or perhaps you'd prefer to kick back on the beach, soaking in the sunshine and watching the lively wildlife around you. Whatever you decide, make it a day to remember, filled with relaxation and joy.

Indulge in the tranquility of the early morning as the sun paints the sky with hues of gold over Boothbay Harbor. Fuel your day with the flavors of the region by venturing into town for a delectable local breakfast, setting the perfect tone for what lies ahead. As the day unfolds, embark on a personalized kayaking adventure along the rugged coastline. Glide through crystal-clear waters, navigating around rocky outcrops and hidden coves, while keeping a keen eye out for playful seals, graceful sea life, and majestic aquatic birds. Your knowledgeable guide will regale you with fascinating insights into the intricate ecosystems that thrive in these coastal waters, enriching your journey with a deeper understanding of the natural world around you.

Rise and shine as you set your course southward along the picturesque coast to the vibrant city of Portland, Maine. Arriving just in time to catch the morning light dancing on the waves, you'll embark on an exhilarating maritime adventure aboard an authentic Maine lobster boat. Join the seasoned crew as they guide you through the age-old tradition of hauling traps, immersing yourself in the rich maritime heritage of the region while learning fascinating tales about the area's seafaring past. Feel the salty breeze against your skin as you take part in this hands-on experience, gaining newfound appreciation for the time-honored art of lobstering. And for the ultimate treat, why not indulge in the opportunity to purchase your freshly caught bounty straight from the source? With your prized catch in hand, head ashore to the renowned Portland Lobster Company, where you'll savor the satisfaction of enjoying a mouthwatering meal crafted from your own haul, a true taste of Maine's coastal bounty.

Embark on a journey to Cape Elizabeth, where breathtaking vistas of the Atlantic await you at Fort Williams Park. As you wander along the rugged coastline, immerse yourself in the natural beauty that surrounds you. Traverse winding paths that hug the cliffs, offering panoramic views of the vast expanse of ocean stretching out before you. Feel the invigorating sea breeze brush against your skin, carrying with it the salty scent of the sea. Don't miss the opportunity to explore a piece of history with a tour of a genuine, operational lighthouse. Step inside and marvel at the intricate inner workings of this iconic beacon, while learning about its vital role in guiding ships safely along the rocky shores. With each step, let the rugged beauty of Cape Elizabeth captivate your senses, leaving you with cherished memories of a day spent in harmony with nature's splendor.
It's time to bid farewell, carrying memories of adventures that will last a lifetime!

tourName: New York State holiday, USA
placesVisited: New York City, Delaware National Forest, Finger Lakes region, Niagara Falls, Rochester, Lake Ontario, Lake Placid, Adirondack Mountains, Saratoga Springs, optional activities around Finger Lakes include: walking, canoeing, mountain biking and fishing
generalInfo:
New York City is one of the most popular cities to visit in the USA, but many visitors pass by the rest of New York State, which has much to explore and discover.

This itinerary begins by taking in the magnificent Niagara Falls before heading inland into New York State. Spend time in the tranquil Finger Lakes region, where you can enjoy a boat trip out on the water.

You can also taste some of the state's finest wines in the Ithaca wine producing region and follow hiking trails through the beautiful Adirondack Mountains, home to beavers, Canadian lynx and ospreys. Your trip finishes up in New York City with plenty of time for you to soak up all the 'Big Apple' has to offer.
